start.text: You are a patient in a healthcare clinic. Choose your avatar:

young.text: You are presented with some symptoms: abdominal pain, weigh loss, non specific fevers. The doctor asks: Have you had a colonoscopy in the last 5 years?

young_colonoscopy.text: It’s unlikely that you need another one. Colon cancer is very slow-growing and your symptoms are nonspecific at this point.

choices.text: Get blood test and CT scans.

young_no_colonoscopy.text: Then your doctor will order one to be sure..

choices.text: Get blood test and CT scans and colonoscopy.

elderly.text: It’s unlikely that you need a colonoscopy because of your age. Colon cancer is very slow-growing and your symptoms are nonspecific at this point.

choices.text: Get blood test and CT scans.

more_tests.text: Your test results come back and you are diagnosed with gastric cancer. The doctor will assess your best treatment options. Does it run in the family?

runs_in_family.text: Since that’s the case, let’s sequence your tumor to see if it is one of the known genes. Some of these mutations can be treated with targeted therapy.

no_runs_in_family.text: Colon cancer doesn’t run in your family, but let’s sequence your tumor to see if there are targeted therapies available.

sequence.text: Your data enters a biobank to collect information and enable the future of cancer research. Is it possible your data will contribute to “structured missingness” in the biobank data?
